oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Ed Horne, jazz promoter, dies"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Horne, Ed; jazz; music; 1990s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Edward Armour Horne, a former disc jockey for radio station WLOK and a jazz promoter who brought famous artists to Memphis in the 1970s and 1980s, died Tuesday. He was 69. R.S. Lewis & Sons Funeral Home has charge. -- Horne was a disc jockey at the station in the late 1960s and early 1970s. Later he turned to promoting jazz, bringing in such greats as Pepper Adams and Quincy Jones. 'The jazz community will miss Ed greatly,' said Vasco Smith, county commissioner and jazz buff. -- Horne was a retired Postal Service supervisor. -- He leaves a daughter, Jaye S. Horne; his mother, Joy Horne; two sisters, Nanilee Banks and Jeanetta Powell, and a brother, Leonard Horne, all of Memphis."
